question.text: From the following pairs determine the correctly described cellular parts.

options.text: Thylakoids - Flattened membranous sacs forming the grana of chloroplasts
Centrioles - Sites for active RNA synthesis

Ribosomes - Those in chloroplasts are larger <math><mo>(</mo><mn>80</mn><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo></math>  while those in the cytoplasm are smaller  <math><mo>(</mo><mn>70</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo></math>
Lysosomes - Optically active at a  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>  of about  <math><mn>8.5</mn></math>

solution.text: Within the chloroplasts, there are stacks of disc shaped membranous structure called granum and individual disc is called thylakoid. This is a flattened structure which holds the chlorophyll within its lumen, thus, making the site for light reaction. Chloroplasts have  <math><mn>70</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>  ribosome within it. Centriole is for cell division in animal cell. Lysosomes are more active at lower pH
